text.text: How do I access the Patient Addresses report?

text: To access the Patient Addresses report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Patient Addresses. 3. Current Payer: Click to select the payer you want in the report. 4. Claim Status: Select one or more statuses or select all. 5. Click View Report.

text.text: What types of addresses are included in the report?

text: The Patient Addresses report lists all addresses on file for the patient including residential, guarantor, and subscriber. If there is no guarantor or patient billing address then the patient's name displays in the Guarantor Name eld and the patient's address displays in the Address eld.

text.text: What types of addresses are included in the report?

text: If there is a guarantor on the patient’s account, the guarantor’s name and address displays in the Guarantor Name and Address eld. If there is no guarantor on the account but there is a patient billing address, then the patient’s name displays in the Guarantor Name eld and the billing address displays in the Address eld.

text.text: What information does the report provide for patients and guarantors?

text: The Patient Addresses report also contains the following columns of information: Patient: Account number First, middle, and last name DOB Phone number and type Primary policy name and type Current policy type Residential addresses Guarantor: First, middle, and last name DOB Relationship to patient Phone number and type Addresses Billing information - city, state, zip, and country Claim numbers

text.text: How can I export the Patient Addresses report?

text: The best way to export the Patient Addresses report is to export the report to a .csv file. You can then change, rearrange, and delete data as needed before sending it to the agency.

text.text: What actions can be taken based on the findings of the report?

text: Possible actions include "Replace in account" and "Remove from account". Keep in mind that any action is optional - you should verify the change before you take action.

text.text: How does the report contribute to maintaining accurate patient records?

text: The report can help you identify duplicate patient records. You can use Merge Patient to consolidate one or more duplicates into one patient record. When you merge patient records, all claims associated with the records remain the same. Users working the claims associated with the merge will still see the claim, with the same claim number in their Inbox.

text.text: What aging buckets are used in the report?

text: The Patient Payer Aging Detail report groups claims in aging buckets of: 0-30 31-60 61-90 90-120 121-180 181+ days.

text.text: What actions should be taken for claims in different aging buckets?

text: When you identify those claims, make sure you use the Patient Billing page to make decisions to either write-off the balance, send the account to a collections or a state debt relief program, suspend patient billing, or continue sending patient statements.

text.text: How does the report help in identifying overdue claims?

text: The report can help you identify overdue claims by pulling open claims that are at least 30, 60, or 90 days past their date of service.

text.text: Can you explain the recommended steps for managing older claims?

text: Use this report daily to catch older claims in need of immediate attention. When you identify those claims, make sure you use the Patient Billing page to make decisions to either write-off the balance, send the account to a collections or a state debt relief program, suspend patient billing, or continue sending patient statements.

text.text: How can I export the Patient Payer Aging Detail report for further analysis?

text: One of the best way to digest the information in the report is to export the report to a .csv file. From there you can view/manage the data. If you are not good with Excel, we have some great videos that will get you started.

text.text: What information does the report provide about repeat customers?

text: The Repeat Customers report lists customers that used your service more than once and the level of service for each claim. The report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest.

text.text: How can the information in the report be used to enhance customer service?

text: If you have a repeat customer program, use the information in this report to target potential enrollees. Identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: Can you provide examples of potential uses for the Repeat Customers report?

text: The Repeat Customers report can be used to target potential enrollees and identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: How frequently should I review the Repeat Customers report?

text: The Repeat Customers report should be reviewed daily.

text.text: What actions can be taken based on the findings of the report?

text: If the findings are different, an action displays. Possible actions include "Replace in account" and "Remove from account".

text.text: How does the report contribute to customer relationship management?

text: The Repeat Customers report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest. It can be used to target potential enrollees and identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: Can you explain the significance of targeting potential enrollees based on repeat customer data?

text: The Repeat Customers report can be used to target potential enrollees and identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: How does the report assist in identifying customer support needs?

text: The Repeat Customers report can be used to identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: How can I download data from the Active tab for analysis?

text: You can download data from the Active tab to a CSV file for review.

text.text: What is the significance of the Final Statement Pending tab?

text: The Final Statement Pending tab shows a list of patients who are down to the wire - they only have one more scheduled invoice. You may want to use this list to send final notices, call the patient to ask for a payment or to inquire if they received retroactive Medicaid.

text.text: How to run Patient Addresses report?

text: To run the Patient Addresses report, you can follow these steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Analytics and click Reports. 2. Scroll down the list and click Patient Addresses. 3. Current Payer: Click to select the payer you want in the report. 4. Claim Status: Select one or more statuses or select all. 5. Click View Report.

text.text: what is the use of Repeat Customers?

text: Repeat Customers shows a list of customers that used your service more than once and the level of service for each claim. The report lists the customers with the highest number of claims first, followed by the lowest. Possible use for this type of information: If you have a repeat customer program, use the information in this report to target potential enrollees. Identify customers that may need assistance from agencies or support organizations.

text.text: what does the active tab show?

text: The Active tab shows all accounts that have at least one claim in the account where the patient is the current payer. On this tab you can find the patient name, account number, the date the last statement was sent, amount paid by the patient, and outstanding patient responsibility.

text.text: what does Final Statement Sent tab show?

text: The Final Statement Sent tab shows accounts that the system automatically suspended because the patient has received the maximum number of statements, and the number of statements set on the statement interval has passed. The system is no longer sending patient statements to these patients and all associated claims for which the payer is the patient have been suspended.
